org.semanticweb.vlog4j.core.reasoner

Interface Reasoner

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    VLogReasoner

    public interface Reasoner
extends AutoCloseable
    Interface that exposes the existential rule reasoning capabilities of VLog.
    The knowledge base of the reasoner can be loaded with explicit facts and existential rules that would infer implicit facts trough reasoning.
    Facts can be added to the knowledge base:
    • as in-memory Java objects (#addFacts(Atom...)
    • from a persistent data source (addFactsFromDataSource(Predicate, DataSource))
    Note that facts with the same predicate cannot come from multiple sources (where a source can be a collection of in-memory Atom objects, or a DataSource .
    Rules added to the knowledge base (addRules(Rule...)) can be re-written internally by VLog, using the corresponding set RuleRewriteStrategy.

    Once adding facts and rules to the knowledge base has been completed, the knowledge base can be loaded into the reasoner. The following pre-condition must be respected: the Predicates appearing in Rule heads (called IDBs) cannot also appear in knowledge base facts (called EDBs). An EdbIdbSeparationException would be thrown when loading the knowledge base.

    The loaded reasoner can perform atomic queries on explicit facts before reasoning, and all implicit and explicit facts after calling reason(). Queries can provide an iterator for the results (#answerQuery(Atom, boolean), or the results can be exported to a file (#exportQueryAnswersToCsv(Atom, String, boolean)).

    Reasoning with various Algorithms is supported, that can lead to different sets of inferred facts and different termination behavior. In some cases, reasoning with rules with existentially quantified variables Rule.getExistentiallyQuantifiedVariables() may not terminate. We recommend reasoning with algorithm Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE, as it leads to termination in more cases. To avoid non-termination, a reasoning timeout can be set (setReasoningTimeout(Integer)).
    Incremental reasoning is not supported. To add more facts and rule to the knowledge base and reason again, the reasoner needs to be reset (resetReasoner()) to the state of its knowledge base before loading. Then, more information can be added to the knowledge base, the reasoner can be loaded again, and querying and reasoning can be performed.
    Author:
    Irina Dragoste

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFacts(@NonNull Collection<PositiveLiteral> facts)
      Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void addFacts(PositiveLiteral... facts)
      Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void addFactsFromDataSource(@NonNull Predicate predicate, @NonNull DataSource dataSource)
      Adds facts stored in given dataSource for given predicate to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void addRules(@NonNull List<Rule> rules)
      Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order.
      void addRules(Rule... rules)
      Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order.
      QueryResultIterator answerQuery(@NonNull PositiveLiteral query, boolean includeBlanks)
      Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base: If the reasoner is loaded (see load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts. Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.
      An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK).
      CyclicityResult checkForCycles()
      Checks whether the loaded rules and loaded fact EDB predicates are Acyclic, Cyclic, or cyclicity cannot be determined.
      void close() 
      void exportQueryAnswersToCsv(@NonNull PositiveLiteral query, @NonNull String csvFilePath, boolean includeBlanks)
      Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base, and writes its results the .csv file at given path csvFilePath: If the reasoner is loaded (see load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts. Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.
      An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK).

      • getInstance

        static Reasoner getInstance()
        Factory method that to instantiate a Reasoner.
        Returns:
        a VLogReasoner instance.

      • setAlgorithm

        void setAlgorithm(@NonNull Algorithm algorithm)
        Sets the algorithm that will be used for reasoning over the knowledge base. If no algorithm is set, the default algorithm is Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE will be used.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the algorithm to be used for reasoning.

      • getAlgorithm

        Algorithm getAlgorithm()
        Getter for the algorithm that will be used for reasoning over the knowledge base. The default value is Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE.
        Returns:
        the reasoning algorithm.

      • setReasoningTimeout

        void setReasoningTimeout(@Nullable Integer seconds)
        In some cases, reasoning with rules with existentially quantified variables Rule.getExistentiallyQuantifiedVariables() may not terminate. We recommend reasoning with algorithm Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE, as it leads to termination in more cases.
        This method sets a timeout (in seconds) after which reasoning can be artificially interrupted if it has not reached completion.
        Parameters:
        seconds - interval after which reasoning will be interrupted, in seconds. If null, reasoning will not be interrupted and will return only after (if) it has reached completion.

      • getReasoningTimeout

        @Nullable Integer getReasoningTimeout()
        This method returns the reasoning timeout, representing the interval (in seconds) after which reasoning will be interrupted if it has not reached completion. The default value is null, in which case reasoning terminates only after (if) it reaches completion.
        Returns:
        if not null, number of seconds after which the reasoning will be interrupted, if it has not reached completion.

      • setRuleRewriteStrategy

        void setRuleRewriteStrategy(@NonNull RuleRewriteStrategy ruleRewritingStrategy)
                     throws ReasonerStateException
        Loaded Rules can be re-written internally to an equivalent set of rules, according to given ruleRewritingStrategy. If no staregy is set, the default value is RuleRewriteStrategy.NONE, meaning that the rules will not be re-written.
        Parameters:
        ruleRewritingStrategy - strategy according to which the rules will be rewritten before reasoning.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded.

      • getRuleRewriteStrategy

        @NonNull RuleRewriteStrategy getRuleRewriteStrategy()
        Getter for the strategy according to which rules will be rewritten before reasoning. The default value is RuleRewriteStrategy.NONE, meaning that the rules will not be re-written.
        Returns:
        the current rule re-writing strategy

      • setLogLevel

        void setLogLevel(@NonNull LogLevel logLevel)
          throws ReasonerStateException
        Sets the logging level of the internal VLog C++ resource. Default value is LogLevel.WARNING
        Parameters:
        logLevel - the logging level to be set for VLog C++ resource.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the method is called on a closed reasoner.

      • getLogLevel

        @Nullable LogLevel getLogLevel()
        Returns the logging level of the internal VLog C++ resource. If no value has been set, the default is LogLevel.WARNING.
        Returns:
        the logging level of the VLog C++ resource.

      • setLogFile

        void setLogFile(@Nullable String filePath)
         throws ReasonerStateException
        Redirects the logs of the internal VLog C++ resource to given file. If no log file is set or the given filePath is not a valid file path, VLog will log to the default system output.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file for the internal VLog C++ resource to log to. If null or an invalid file path, the reasoner will log to the default system output.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the method is called on a closed reasoner.

      • addRules

        void addRules(Rule... rules)
       throws ReasonerStateException
        Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order. After the reasoner has been loaded (load()), the rules may be rewritten internally according to the set RuleRewriteStrategy.
        Parameters:
        rules - non-null rules to be added to the knowledge base for reasoning.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the rules literals contain terms which are not of type TermType.CONSTANT or TermType.VARIABLE.

      • addRules

        void addRules(@NonNull List<Rule> rules)
       throws ReasonerStateException
        Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order. Rules can only be added before loading (load()). After the reasoner has been loaded, the rules may be rewritten internally according to the set RuleRewriteStrategy.
        Parameters:
        rules - non-null rules to be added to the knowledge base for reasoning.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the rules literals contain terms which are not of type TermType.CONSTANT or TermType.VARIABLE.

      • getRules

        List<Rule> getRules()
        Get the list of all rules that have been added to the reasoner. The list is read-only and cannot be modified to add or delete rules.
        Returns:
        list of Rule

      • addFacts

        void addFacts(PositiveLiteral... facts)
       throws ReasonerStateException
        Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base. A fact is a PositiveLiteral with all terms (Literal.getTerms()) of type TermType.CONSTANT.
        Facts can only be added before loading (load()).
        Facts predicates (Literal.getPredicate()) cannot have multiple data sources.
        Parameters:
        facts - facts to be added to the knowledge base. The given order is not maintained.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded (load()).
        IllegalArgumentException - if the knowledge base contains facts from a data source with the same predicate (Literal.getPredicate()) as a PositiveLiteral among given facts.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the facts literals contain terms which are not of type TermType.CONSTANT.

      • addFacts

        void addFacts(@NonNull Collection<PositiveLiteral> facts)
       throws ReasonerStateException
        Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base. A fact is a PositiveLiteral with all terms (Literal.getTerms()) of type TermType.CONSTANT.
        Facts can only be added before loading (load()).
        Facts predicates (Literal.getPredicate()) cannot have multiple data sources.
        Parameters:
        facts - facts to be added to the knowledge base.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded (load()).
        IllegalArgumentException - if the knowledge base contains facts from a data source with the same predicate (Literal.getPredicate()) as an PositiveLiteral among given facts.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the facts literals contain terms which are not of type TermType.CONSTANT.

      • addFactsFromDataSource

        void addFactsFromDataSource(@NonNull Predicate predicate,
                            @NonNull DataSource dataSource)
                     throws ReasonerStateException
        Adds facts stored in given dataSource for given predicate to the reasoner knowledge base. Facts predicates cannot have multiple data sources, including in-memory Atom objects added trough addFacts(org.semanticweb.vlog4j.core.model.api.PositiveLiteral...).
        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate for which the given dataSource contains fact terms.
        dataSource - data source containing the fact terms to be associated to given predicate and added to the reasoner
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded (load()).
        IllegalArgumentException - if the knowledge base contains facts in memory (added using addFacts(org.semanticweb.vlog4j.core.model.api.PositiveLiteral...)) or from a data source with the same Predicate as given predicate.

      • load

        void load()
   throws IOException,
          EdbIdbSeparationException,
          IncompatiblePredicateArityException,
          ReasonerStateException
        Loads the knowledge base, consisting of the current rules and facts, into the reasoner (if it has not been loaded yet). If the reasoner has already been loaded, this call does nothing. After loading, the reasoner is ready for reasoning and querying.
        Loading pre-condition: the Predicates appearing in Rule heads (Rule.getHead()), called IDB predicates, cannot also appear in knowledge base facts, called EDB predicates. An EdbIdbSeparationException would be thrown in this case.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs related to the resources in the knowledge base to be loaded.
        EdbIdbSeparationException - if a Predicate appearing in a Rule head (IDB predicate) also appears in a knowledge base fact (EDB predicate).
        IncompatiblePredicateArityException - if the arity of a Predicate of a fact loaded from a data source (addFactsFromDataSource(Predicate, DataSource)) does nor match the arity of the facts in the corresponding data source.
        ReasonerStateException - if the method is called on a closed reasoner.

      • checkForCycles

        CyclicityResult checkForCycles()
                        throws ReasonerStateException,
                               karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Checks whether the loaded rules and loaded fact EDB predicates are Acyclic, Cyclic, or cyclicity cannot be determined.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isJA

        boolean isJA()
      throws ReasonerStateException,
             karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Check the Joint Acyclicity (JA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is JA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Skolem chase (and, implicitly, the Restricted chase) will always terminate
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Joint Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isRJA

        boolean isRJA()
       throws ReasonerStateException,
              karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Check the Restricted Joint Acyclicity (RJA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is RJA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Restricted chase will always terminate
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Restricted Joint Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isMFA

        boolean isMFA()
       throws ReasonerStateException,
              karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Check the Model-Faithful Acyclicity (MFA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is MFA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Skolem chase (and, implicitly, the Restricted chase) will always terminate
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Model-Faithful Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isRMFA

        boolean isRMFA()
        throws ReasonerStateException,
               karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Check the Restricted Model-Faithful Acyclicity (RMFA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is RMFA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Restricted chase will always terminate. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is MFA, then it is also JA.
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Restricted Model-Faithful Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isMFC

        boolean isMFC()
       throws ReasonerStateException,
              karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Check the Model-Faithful Cyclicity (MFC) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is MFC, then there exists a set of facts over the given EDB predicates for which reasoning by Skolem chase algorithm is guaranteed not to terminate for the loaded rules. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is RMFA, then it is also RJA. Therefore, if a set or rules and EDB predicates is MFC, it is not MFA, nor JA.
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Model-Faithful Cyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • reason

        boolean reason()
        throws IOException,
               ReasonerStateException
        Performs reasoning on the loaded knowledge base, depending on the set Algorithm. Reasoning implies extending the set of explicit facts in the knowledge base with implicit facts inferred by knowledge base rules.

        In some cases, reasoning with rules with existentially quantified variables Rule.getExistentiallyQuantifiedVariables() may not terminate. We recommend reasoning with algorithm Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE, as it leads to termination in more cases.
        To avoid non-termination, a reasoning timeout can be set (setReasoningTimeout(Integer)).

        Incremental reasoning is not supported. To add more facts and rule to the knowledge base and reason again, the reasoner needs to be reset (resetReasoner()) to the state of its knowledge base before loading. Then, more information can be added to the knowledge base, the reasoner can be loaded again, and querying and reasoning can be performed.
        Returns:
        • the value returned by the previous reason() call, if successive reasoning is attempted before a resetReasoner().
        • true, if reasoning reached completion.
        • false, if reasoning has been interrupted before completion.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O exceptions occur during reasoning.
        ReasonerStateException - if this method is called before loading (load() or after closing (close()).

      • answerQuery

        QueryResultIterator answerQuery(@NonNull PositiveLiteral query,
                                boolean includeBlanks)
                         throws ReasonerStateException
        Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base:
        • If the reasoner is loaded (see load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts.
        • Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.

        An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK). The same variable name identifies the same term in the answer fact.
        A query answer is represented by a QueryResult. A query can have multiple, distinct query answers. This method returns an Iterator over these answers.
        Parameters:
        query - a PositiveLiteral representing the query to be answered.
        includeBlanks - if true, facts containing terms of type TermType.BLANK (representing anonymous individuals introduced to satisfy rule existentially quantified variables) will be included into the query results. Otherwise, the query results will only contain the facts with terms of type TermType.CONSTANT (representing named individuals).
        Returns:
        an AutoCloseable iterator for QueryResults, representing distinct answers to the query.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if this method is called before loading (load() or after closing (close()).
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given queryAtom contains terms (Atom.getTerms()) which are not of type TermType.CONSTANT or TermType.VARIABLE.

      • exportQueryAnswersToCsv

        void exportQueryAnswersToCsv(@NonNull PositiveLiteral query,
                             @NonNull String csvFilePath,
                             boolean includeBlanks)
                      throws ReasonerStateException,
                             IOException
        Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base, and writes its results the .csv file at given path csvFilePath:
        • If the reasoner is loaded (see load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts.
        • Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.

        An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK). The same variable name identifies the same term in the answer fact.
        A query answer is represented by a QueryResult. A query can have multiple, distinct query answers.
        Parameters:
        query - a PositiveLiteral representing the query to be answered.
        csvFilePath - path to a .csv file where the query answers will be written. Each line of the .csv file represents a query answer fact, and it will contain the fact term names as columns.
        includeBlanks - if true, facts containing terms of type TermType.BLANK (representing anonymous individuals introduced to satisfy rule existentially quantified variables) will be included into the query answers. Otherwise, the query answers will only contain the facts with terms of type TermType.CONSTANT (representing named individuals).
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if this method is called before loading (load() or after closing (close()).
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs regarding given file (csvFilePath).
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the given queryAtom contains terms (Atom.getTerms()) which are not of type TermType.CONSTANT or TermType.VARIABLE.
        • if the given csvFilePath does not end with .csv extension.

      • resetReasoner

        void resetReasoner()
            throws ReasonerStateException
        Resets the reasoner to a pre-loading state (before the call of load() method). All facts inferred by reasoning are discarded. Rules and facts added to the reasoner need to be loaded again, to be able to perform querying and reasoning.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the method is called on a closed reasoner.

        close in interface AutoCloseable
